title: Veigar doesn't laugh after killing enemy champions with his ult anymore.
body:
So lately I've been noticing a lack of Veigar's laugh every time I play him. I was curious enough to test this on my own just now. 

I just got out of the custom game testing this. Farmed Q a bit, and made the bot fiddle low enough for my ult to last hit; it killed him, but Veigar didn't laugh.


Please fix this, Riot.

I can understand your frustration.

While I don't have the answers to why Sona was nerfed, I can try to explain why it hasn't been addressed. With that being said, I've gone ahead and looked up a popular thread, and sent it to the team who's responsible for the balance changes. 

Winter break happened shortly after that PBE update went out on December 15th, which meant a lot of us were out of the office either traveling, taking some time to visit family, or celebrating the holidays! That meant a lot less of us were checking the boards. 

In addition, many PBE changes aren't totally explained since things on the PBE aren't always 100% definite. Tentative content does hit PBE, since it's a good environment to see if changes are good, and will be a positive change to the overall game. Should these changes make it to the live environment, they'll likely be explained in the patch notes.

I'm not trying to make excuses, just trying to shed light on the Sona example specifically. And again, I've gone ahead and passed on one of the threads to the proper team. :D

Sona being nerfed wasn't the only point of that post. Metaworldpeace10 was trying to figure out why champ A gets a nerf, while champ B won't even be commented on. Why does Leona (who has 3x times the game played) and Janna (who has 50% more games played) have a higher win rate in the past month but Sona is the one touched?

I love Riot, and I don't want to sound toxic. But when the player base asks for communication they don't mean just swing by and say "hi". I don't know how many posts I have seen using Red Tracker where it seems the Rioter totally missed the point of the post in the first place. That is the most frustrating part. 

I know you (as a company) are trying to not use a Community Manager. You want everyone to be able to talk to us, and we love you for that. But you might need a few, just to funnel the hot topics to those at Riot who understand an issue and can bring knowledge to a post.

Nope! You should still be posting bugs under the Report A Bug thread. We read through those daily, and although we don't respond to all of them, we do investigate them.

I don't want to sound like an entitled brat, but...I think you should, or at the very least have some sort of function in the forums that lets players know that someone in Riot has read their report even if they haven't replied.


Especially in Bug Reports, there are thousands of bugs in the game and you are only 1 in a sea of many. Just because you claim to look at each one and investigate them doesn't make the notion that *"they missed mine because I'm just one in a crowd!"* or *"they missed mine because they haven't addressed my bug in 2 years!"* unbelievable.


Some sort of *"your thread has been read by a Rioter"* tag would be nice so you don't have to make multiple threads reporting the exact same thing hoping your reports been seen.


**PS** - YES,  there ARE bugs I've been sending to Bug Reports for a year or more and I still haven't seen them addressed in any patch notes!  {{champion:161}}  {{champion:3}} and {{champion:50}} all have a crippling GAMEPLAY bug that screws them over unlike a laugh upon ulting bug.
